name: Flair Airlines New Livery Boeing 737-800 Takeoff from Calgary Airport
description:
Flair's new livery in daylight! It's certainly caused a bit of controversy among Canadian aviation enthusiasts, but it's grown on me quite a bit since it was unveiled in February this year. It's definitely eye catching.

Here's their first Boeing 737-800 taxiing out from Apron IV, after an overnight maintenance check at Skyservice, and departing a bit later for Vancouver as "Flair 137".

Enjoy!

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: Flair Airlines (FLE/F8)
Aircraft: Boeing 737-800 (B738)
Flight Number: F8137
Livery: New (2019) 
Engines: 2x CFMI CFM56-7B26 
Registration: C-FFLA
Route: Calgary (YYC) - Vancouver (YVR)
Callsign: FLAIR 137
Runway used: 35L
Date filmed: May 2019
Local time: 1100
